ovdesc.p: The Account Debit Interest table allows special Debit Interest conditions to be defined for individual Accounts when the corresponding Group Debit Interest conditions are not suitable.
To avoid unnecessary work, Account Debit Interest records should only be set up in special cases.
The Account Debit Interest Table allows for a specific Account:
- Interest to be calculated on a Daily, Average, or Highest balance basis using value dated balances.
- Rates to be fixed or linked to Basic Rates plus or minus a Margin.

- Different rates to be specified for different balance levels which may be linked to the same or different Basic Rates. The rates can apply to the whole of the balance or to the part between two balance levels.

The Current record for an account on this file may be automatically created or updated by the Start of Day processing. This is done when Account Debit Int records exist for an account and the account record specifies that the limit field from this record should be linked to the LIMIT file.

Field range DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT is used to specify rates applicable to different balance limits. Specifies a floating Basic Rate which is held on the BASIC.INTEREST table (Ref: General Tables).
Rates can be fixed or linked to Basic Rates plus or minus a Margin.

1-4 numeric characters. Multivalue field associated with field range DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT. (Optional input. Not allowed if corresponding DR.INT.RATE is input or if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS contains NONE or GENERAL.)

There must be a record in the BASIC.INTEREST table (Ref: General Tables) with a key consisting of this code, the Currency of the Account and an effective date which is less than or equal to the date specified in ID. Examples: The rate or rates of interest which will be applied are defined by the following multivalue group of fields: BASIC RATE INT RATE MARGIN OPER MARGIN RATE LIMIT AMOUNT Examples of their use is as follows: 1) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate, only enter the following field: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate. 2) If the interest rate is to be fixed, only enter the following field: INT RATE - the actual rate of interest. 3) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate plus a margin, enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Base Rate MARGIN OPER - ADD MARGIN RATE - the actual Marginal Rate. 4) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate plus a Percentage of the floating Basic Rate; enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - MULTIPLY MARGIN RATE - Percentage to be added 5) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate, plus a Margin up to a limiting amount and a floating Basic Rate, plus a different Margin above that limiting amount, enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - ADD MARGIN RATE - first Margin rate LIMIT AMOUNT - The limit amount for the above defined rate BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - ADD MARGIN RATE - 2nd Margin rate.
Specifies a condition group which the Maximum Legal Rate is linked to.
If this field is specified the condition group with the latest date in GROUP.CONDITION will be used to derive the Maximum Legal Rate.

AVERAGE, DAILY or HIGHEST, or any abbreviation thereof. Input not allowed if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS contains NONE or GENERAL, otherwise mandatory).
Identifies the maximum charge percentage of the first debit interest amount. (e.g. 50%)
1-10 type R (standard rate format) characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input. Default = null.)
Specifies the balance limit up to and including which the rates specified in corresponding field range DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.MARGIN.RATE applies.
For examples see DR.BASIC.RATE.

Up to 14 type AMT (standard amount format) numeric characters. Multivalue field associated with field range DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT. (Mandatory input, if more than one set of field range DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT is specified but not allowed for last set or if only one set is input.)
Where more than one DR Limit Amount is input, these must be in ascending sequence.

Defines the method of determining the number of days used for debit interest calculations. If not entered, the Basis specified on the CURRENCY table (Ref: General Tables) will be used. By entering GENERAL, it is possible to specify a return to Group Debit Interest calculation with effect from the date specified in ID. If no debit interest is to be calculated on this Account, NONE should be entered.
In each of the options specified below the number on the left represents the number of days basis for multiplying

Where G is entered, this is expanded to GENERAL and is used to indicate that on the date specified by ACCOUNT.NO.DATE, the Account should revert to the Group Debit Interest record for details of debit interest calculations.
Can accept the following types:
For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASIS
1-9 characters A ,B , C, D, E, F, GENERAL or NONE. (Optional input; default from CURRENCY table.)
If NONE or GENERAL is entered, all Fields after this must be blank.

If GENERAL is entered, there must be an existing Group Debit Interest record for the appropriate Currency and Condition Group, with effective date less than or equal to the effective date of this record.

A setting of Yes indicates that debit interest amounts below the minimum value, specified in DR2.MIN.VALUE, are to be waived. If HIST options are selected then during correction the system uses the mid reval rate on correction period end to convert the minimum amount
If this field is set to No or Null, the minimum value in DR2.MIN.VALUE, should be posted to the account.
Allowed values are YES, NO, YES-HIST, NO-HIST or NULL.
Determines whether the calculation will be performed up to the debit balance Level or in Bands (where the interest calculation employed is dependent upon the size of debit balance).

If more than one set of field range DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT is input, this indicates that a different interest rate is applicable depending on the size of the debit balance. DR Calcul Type specifies whether separate calculations are to be made for each Band of the debit balance or one is to be made on the entire balance, dependent on the Level of the balance.
Example: Assume a debit balance of 15,000 and an Account Debit Interest record which specifies an applicable rate of 10 per cent up to 10,000 and 15 per cent above 10,000.
If Band is specified, 2 calculations will be performed, i.e.
10 per cent on 10,000 15 per cent on 5,000
If Level is specified, 1 calculation will be performed, i.e.
15 per cent on 15,000.

BAND or LEVEL or any abbreviation thereof. (Mandatory input if more than one set of field range DR.BASIC.RATE to DR.LIMIT.AMT is input, otherwise optional. Not allowed if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS contains NONE or GENERAL.)

Identifies either a Tax record (defined in TAX table) or Tax.Type.Condition record with a "*" symbol prefixed to a valid tax.type.condition which specifies the calculation and processing of tax, applicable to debit interest. If tax rate is given then tax is calculated for the account on the given tax rate. If a Tax Type Condition Identifier is specified, the system will derive the applicable TAX.CODE from the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION based on the customer grouping. Input of tax.type.condition will deduct tax at applicable rate for the customer.
1-2 numeric characters. (Optional input. Not allowed if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS contains NONE or GENERAL.)
There must be an existing record for this code on the TAX table (Ref: General Tables) with an effective date not later than the effective date of this record.

For computation of tax JOINT HOLDER wise for an account based on their tax status, only a valid TAX.TYPE.CONDITION ID has to be specified along with a local routine in CALC.ROUTINE field. eg. *CGT has to be specified.
The TAX.OPERAND in the corresponding Tax record should be PLUS

Field range DR2.BASIC.RATE to DR2.LIMIT.AMT is used to specify rates applicable to different balance limits. Determines the method by which the Rate specified in corresponding DR2.BASIC.RATE or DR2.INT.RATE is adjusted by the Margin specified in corresponding DR2.MARGIN.RATE. (DR2 fields specify a second interest charge which may be levied.)

If the Rate specified in DR2.BASIC.RATE or DR2.INT.RATE is to adjusted by a Margin, this field specifies whether the Margin Rate is to be added to, subtracted from, or multiplied with the basic rate to arrive at the effective interest rate.
If Multiply is specified the final rate is (100 + M) percent of the Rate from DR2.BASIC.RATE or DR2.INT.RATE where M is the Margin Rate percentage from DR2.MARGIN.RATE.
For examples see DR.BASIC.RATE.

ADD, SUBTRACT or MULTIPLY, or any abbreviation thereof. Multivalue field associated with field range DR2.BASIC.RATE to DR2.LIMIT.AMT. (Optional input. Only allowed if corresponding DR2.BASIC.RATE or DR2.INT.RATE is input.)
This field defines the minimum rate for debit interest to be applied to the DR balance type. If the derived rate is less than this rate then the interest rate will be capped by this rate.

Specifies the General Charge record which defines the charges and overrides applicable to the Account.
Note: No Ledger Fee Charges are calculated in the month in which an Account is opened or closed (unless the Account Closure date is the last day of the month).
The General Charge record which is in effect on the date of the debit interest capitalisation specifies the interest related charges applicable to the whole capitalisation period.

Reserved for future use.
No Input
There are 3 options (YES, BLOCK.MARGIN and NO/Blank)
Blank or NO
Indicates that negative rates cannot be input and if a rate becomes negative as a result of the application of a margin the rate will be set to zero
YES
Indicates that negative rates can be input and if the application margin makes the rate more negative
then the more negative rate will be used.
BLOCK.MARGIN
Indicates that negative rates can be used but the following conditions apply
- If the rate is positive and the margin makes the rate negative then the rate will be set to zero
- If the rate is negative and the margin makes the rate more negative then the margin will be ignored and the original negative rate is used
- If the total debit interest on capitalisation is a debit to the customer then update AC.PENDING as per the exsisting functionality
- If the total debit interest on capitalisation is a credit to the customer then the interest will be posted directly to the customer account

- If correction takes place for a debit interest which results in a credit to the customer account and we have an AC.PENDING record present then AC.PENDING record is updated with the negative amount and the interest pending processing would then do the correct interest posting based on the dates defined.
